verses.verse: Then <S%H464>Eliphaz<s%> the <S%H8489>Temanite<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said<s%>,

If we <S%H5254>assay<s%> to <S%H1697>commune<s%> with thee, wilt thou be <S%H3811>grieved<s%>? but who <S%H3201>can<s%> <S%H6113>withhold<s%> himself from <S%H4405>speaking<s%>? to: Heb. a word withhold: Heb. refrain from words?
Behold, thou hast <S%H3256>instructed<s%> <S%H7227>many<s%>, and thou hast <S%H2388>strengthened<s%> the <S%H7504>weak<s%> <S%H3027>hands<s%>.
Thy <S%H4405>words<s%> have <S%H6965>upholden<s%> him that was <S%H3782>falling<s%>, and thou hast <S%H553>strengthened<s%> the <S%H3766>feeble<s%> <S%H1290>knees<s%>.
But now it is <S%H935>come<s%> upon thee, and thou <S%H3811>faintest<s%>; it <S%H5060>toucheth<s%> thee, and thou art <S%H926>troubled<s%>.
Is not this thy <S%H3374>fear<s%>, thy <S%H3690>confidence<s%>, thy <S%H8615>hope<s%>, and the <S%H8537>uprightness<s%> of thy <S%H1870>ways<s%>?
<S%H2142>Remember<s%>, I pray thee, who ever <S%H6>perished<s%>, being <S%H5355>innocent<s%>? or <S%H375>where<s%> were the <S%H3477>righteous<s%> cut <S%H3582>off<s%>?
Even as I have <S%H7200>seen<s%>, they that <S%H2790>plow<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%>, and <S%H2232>sow<s%> <S%H5999>wickedness<s%>, <S%H7114>reap<s%> the same.
By the <S%H5397>blast<s%> of <S%H433>God<s%> they <S%H6>perish<s%>, and by the <S%H7307>breath<s%> of his <S%H639>nostrils<s%> are they <S%H3615>consumed<s%>. by the breath: that is, by his anger
The <S%H7581>roaring<s%> of the <S%H738>lion<s%>, and the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the fierce <S%H7826>lion<s%>, and the <S%H8127>teeth<s%> of the young <S%H3715>lions<s%>, are <S%H5421>broken<s%>.
The old <S%H3918>lion<s%> <S%H6>perisheth<s%> for <S%H1097>lack<s%> of <S%H2964>prey<s%>, and the stout <S%H3833>lion's<s%> <S%H1121>whelps<s%> are scattered <S%H6504>abroad<s%>.
Now a <S%H1697>thing<s%> was secretly <S%H1589>brought<s%> to me, and mine <S%H241>ear<s%> <S%H3947>received<s%> a <S%H8102>little<s%> thereof. secretly: Heb. by stealth
In <S%H5587>thoughts<s%> from the <S%H2384>visions<s%> of the <S%H3915>night<s%>, when deep <S%H8639>sleep<s%> <S%H5307>falleth<s%> on <S%H582>men<s%>,
<S%H6343>Fear<s%> <S%H7122>came<s%> upon me, and <S%H7461>trembling<s%>, which made <S%H7230>all<s%> my <S%H6106>bones<s%> to <S%H6342>shake<s%>. came: Heb. met all: Heb. the multitude of
Then a <S%H7307>spirit<s%> <S%H2498>passed<s%> before my <S%H6440>face<s%>; the <S%H8185>hair<s%> of my <S%H1320>flesh<s%> stood <S%H5568>up<s%>:

It stood <S%H5975>still<s%>, but I could not <S%H5234>discern<s%> the <S%H4758>form<s%> thereof: an <S%H8544>image<s%> was before mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, there was <S%H1827>silence<s%>, and I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H6963>voice<s%>, saying, there: or, I heard a still voice
Shall mortal <S%H582>man<s%> be more <S%H6663>just<s%> than <S%H433>God<s%>? shall a <S%H1397>man<s%> be more <S%H2891>pure<s%> than his <S%H6213>maker<s%>?
Behold, he put no <S%H539>trust<s%> in his <S%H5650>servants<s%>; and his <S%H4397>angels<s%> he <S%H7760>charged<s%> with <S%H8417>folly<s%>: and his: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light

How much <S%H637>less<s%> in them that <S%H7931>dwell<s%> in <S%H1004>houses<s%> of <S%H2563>clay<s%>, whose <S%H3247>foundation<s%> is in the <S%H6083>dust<s%>, which are <S%H1792>crushed<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H6211>moth<s%>?
They are <S%H3807>destroyed<s%> from <S%H1242>morning<s%> to <S%H6153>evening<s%>: they <S%H6>perish<s%> for <S%H5331>ever<s%> without any <S%H7760>regarding<s%> it. destroyed: Heb. beaten in pieces
Doth not their <S%H3499>excellency<s%> which is in them go <S%H5265>away<s%>? they <S%H4191>die<s%>, even without <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>.
